title: Russell, New York
text:
Russell is a <a href="Administrative%20divisions%20of%20New%20York%23Town">town</a> in <a href="St.%20Lawrence%20County%2C%20New%20York">St. Lawrence County, New York</a>, United States. The population was 1,856 at the 2010 census. The town is named after Russell Attwater, the pioneer land owner.
The Town of Russell is centrally located in the county and is south of <a href="Canton%20%28village%29%2C%20New%20York">Canton</a>.
History.
The town land was purchased by Russell Atwater in 1798. The town was first settled in 1805.
Russell Attwater was elected the first town supervisor, when the town was formed in 1807 from <a href="Hopkinton%2C%20New%20York">Hopkinton</a> from previously named townships: Dewitt, Ballybean and Sarahsburg. In 1813 and 1816, part of Russell was removed to form the <a href="Fowler%2C%20New%20York">Town of Fowler</a>. More of Russell was taken to form, in whole or part, the Towns of <a href="Rossie%2C%20New%20York">Rossie</a> (1813), <a href="Pierrepont%2C%20New%20York">Pierrepont</a> (1818), and <a href="Fine%2C%20New%20York">Fine</a> (1849).
During the <a href="War%20of%201812">War of 1812</a>, an <a href="arsenal">arsenal</a> was located in the town near Russell village. Sold in 1865, it served as a school for many years. The Arsenal was destroyed by fire in 1945.
The <a href="Russell%20Town%20Hall">Russell Town Hall</a> was listed on the <a href="National%20Register%20of%20Historic%20Places">National Register of Historic Places</a> in 1996.
Geography.
According to the <a href="United%20States%20Census%20Bureau">United States Census Bureau</a>, the town has a total area of , of which is land and (0.54%) is water.
The <a href="Grasse%20River">Grasse River</a> flows northward through the town.
Demographics.
As of the <a href="census">census</a> of 2000, there were 1,801 people, 650 households, and 482 families residing in the town. The <a href="population%20density">population density</a> was 18.6 people per square mile (7.2/km2). There were 854 housing units at an average density of 8.8 per square mile (3.4/km2). The racial makeup of the town was 99.00% <a href="White%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">White</a>, 0.17% <a href="African%20American%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">African American</a>, 0.22% <a href="Native%20American%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Native American</a>, 0.22% <a href="Asian%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Asian</a>, 0.06% from <a href="Race%20%28United%20States%20Census%29">other races</a>, and 0.33% from two or more races. <a href="Hispanic%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Hispanic</a> or <a href="Latino%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Latino</a> of any race were 0.11% of the population.
There were 650 households, out of which 39.8% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 59.2% were <a href="Marriage">married couples</a> living together, 8.9% had a female householder with no husband present, and 25.8% were non-families. 19.4% of all households were made up of individuals, and 8.3% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.77 and the average family size was 3.14.
In the town, the population was spread out, with 29.4% under the age of 18, 7.5% from 18 to 24, 30.0% from 25 to 44, 23.2% from 45 to 64, and 9.9% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 35 years. For every 100 females, there were 99.4 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 99.1 males.
The median income for a household in the town was $31,080, and the median income for a family was $36,118. Males had a median income of $31,927 versus $22,895 for females. The <a href="per%20capita%20income">per capita income</a> for the town was $13,530. About 15.7% of families and 19.2% of the population were below the <a href="poverty%20line">poverty line</a>, including 27.1% of those under age 18 and 8.4% of those age 65 or over.
